wp:term.wp:term_description: 50% off each cocktail at our happy hour every friday 6 p.m. to 8 p.m.
All deserts are made from scratch in our kitchen. Prepared fresh… Every day!
Served with your choice of rosemary focaccia, olive ciabatta or garlic baguette
prepeared with love & our own pressed olive oil
Picky eaters, adventurous eaters, whatever your taste - we have something for you.

Whether it's a special occasion, an opportunity for friends to catch up, or a pleasant start to a lazy weekend day, Sunday Brunch is a meal for relaxation and good company. Join us here at LemonChili for Sunday Brunch from 9am to 1pm.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A smooth mix of Finlandia vodka, Kahlua & espresso

Get ready for our annual summer BBQ on August 8th.
We'll serve our famous ribs, organic chicken and also lots of vegetarian options.
Save the date and tell all your friends!

item.title: LemonChili Summer BBQ
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded:
Join us for a delicious summer BBQ and enjoy good food and even better company.
No need to pre-register, just stop on by and join the fun!
<!--more-->

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
“Let Them Talk” is the first album to be recorded by Hugh Laurie after signing to Warner Bros Records in 2010. Produced by Joe Henry and recorded in Los Angeles and New Orleans, the album is a celebration of New Orleans blues, a genre that drives Hugh’s musical raison d’être.
Spiritually inspired by similar genre albums like Ry Cooder’s ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ and T-Bone Burnett’s ‘O’ Brother Where Art Thou’ soundtrack, Hugh’s ‘Let Them Talk’ recordings bring together an extraordinary selection of heritage tracks, renowned musicians and vocal legends to champion this much neglected body of work.

item.title: LemonChili Surf Event
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded: Orange County’s most talented young surfers will take to the waves in Huntington Beach on August 2nd. In addition to gaining high-profile surfing experience, these young athletes look to gain valuable points toward qualifying for a stake at the ASP Junior World Competition scheduled to be held in Australia this year. wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: with fresh basil and balsamic vinaigrette
Grilled garlic & rosemary chicken with a tomato, olive, chilli & caper sauce
prepeared with lots of chilies and lime
topped with lots of fresh herbs

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: served on your choice of grain toast or sourdough bread, topped with rucola and creme fraiche

item.title: Fruit Salad with yuzu vanilla syrup and fresh mint
item.dc:creator: red_sun

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: melon, pineapple, strawberries, mango and banana
with tomato and pepper ragout and greek yoghurt
Pine Nuts, Roquefort, Dates, Asian Pear, Heirloom Apples
Baby Beets, Goat Cheese, Carrots, Radishes
with parmesan cheese, garlic and lemon vinaigrette
A short cocktail of Frangelico, Bacardi Oakheart, Tuaca, pressed apple & peach purée, topped with pomegranate juice
Bacardi Superior rum, Martini Bianco, fresh mint, lime & sugar, topped with Prosecco

item.title: Fried Fish with Asian Coleslaw & Noodles
item.dc:creator: red_sun

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: whole wheat noodles topped with fried fish, beansprouts, carrots, cucumber, red onions, and garlic. garnished with fresh coriander
soft tacos topped with roasted pork, onions, tapatio hot sauce, garnished with freh cilantro
shrimp, basil, cilantro, lettuce, cucumbers, fresh garlic chives, rice vermicelli, all wrapped in rice paper
Lettuce topped with nuts, cranberries, goat cheese and lemon dressing
quinoa topped with grilled red bell peppers, aubergines, zucchini and fresh basil
beef, ham, sausage, mushrooms, cucumber, tomatoes, onions, olives, capers, herbs, served with sourdough bread and butter

item.title: LC special: Grilled cheese with strawberries and chocolate.
item.dc:creator: red_sun

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: sourdough bread, mild gouda, strawberries and milk chocolate
Orange, grapefuit, beet, carrot, apple, ginger, kale, spinach, celery
Bacardi 8yo, Galliano Amaretto, Bacardi 151, passionfruit, lemon juice and grenadine
with pecorino, baby spinach, herbs & toasted pine nuts
Cuervo 1800 Tequila, Massanez Triple Sec and lemon juice; Frozen or shaken.

spiced agave syrup, reposado tequila, cointreau and freshly pressed lime juice.
Served straight up with a half chilli salt rim and garnished with a lime wheel and twist of black pepper
raspberries shaken with ketel one vodka, gekkeikan sake, crème de framboise, finished with lemongrass syrup and lemon juice

item.title: Flavours from all around the world
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded:
The food at LemonChili  is well travelled. We use seasonal ingredients to create dishes that draw influence and flavours from all around the world. Our drinks list is inspired by our own travels and love of diverse styles and flavours. We celebrate a live wine from Granada as much as we do a classic Burgundy.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickies to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: We love...
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded:
Is there a vegetable that sums up winter better than the squash? It’s versatile, homely and comforting. There are more shapes, sizes and colours than you can even count, and we use the very best seasonal ones, including carnival, onion, butternut and spaghetti squashes. Try our amazing pumpkin and squash gnudi when you’re next in – they're lovely soft ricotta dumplings in a squash sauce, mixed with chilli and Stilton cheese. <!--more-->

item.title: We don’t just buy and sell wines, we make them happen.
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded: Together with our customers, we invest in independent winemakers from around the world, in return for exclusive wines at preferential prices. The wines taste fantastic because our winemakers can focus on pouring all their time and passion into making great wines, without compromise. And our customers are rewarded with delicious wines unavailable anywhere else, for far less than they’d normally pay. Check out our Summer Dining wine recommendations.

item.title: Wood fired oven pizza
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded:
I first experienced the amazing versatility and cooking capabilities of wood fired ovens on my travels in Italy and I've been in love with them ever since.
Me and my team here are all wood fired oven fanatics because we believe they really can make your lives and cooking more enjoyable. From the incredible texture and flavours you get from cooking next to the wood, to the fun events they inspire you to have.
Try our pizza dishes with authentical italian flavour here at LemonChili.
Hope to see you soon.<!--more-->

item.title: Let us introduce you to our new summer menu
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded: Our new spring/summer menu is especially exciting as it uses not only excellent seasonal products but much that is “best of California”. The menu has its roots in rustic italian cooking but also reflects our pride in what we produce here in California. wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Milo loves cocktails and is damn good at making them taste great. His cocktail creations are reflective of his own extensive travels and love of combining flavours from all over the world.

Gwyn is passionate about food, wine and service and basically everything to do with the restaurant industry. She loves wines from all over the world and has great fun matching these to the well travelled food menu.

Jen's story is one of guts and determination to follow her dreams of being her own boss and sharing her love of people and cuisine. "Don't lose focus – just do it," says Jen of starting a business. "It doesn't matter how old you are. If you can breathe and move – you can do it."

item.title: Try our new favorite: Ethiopian Yirgacheffee Coffee
item.dc:creator: red_sun
item.content:encoded: Have you tasted our Ethiopian Konga natural Yirgacheffe yet? We think it’s rather special. It’s even been compared to “a hoppy IPA”. It boasts a heavenly fruited dry fragrance with vanilla sweetness. The wet aroma is sweet like honey and the cup has notes of fresh hay with chocolate – the Yirgacheffe district produces some of the most exotic coffee in Africa. This is one of the most distinctive we’ve found, with sweet dried strawberry emerging as the temperature cools. The sweetness from the cherry fruit is absorbed by the bean which intensifies the syrupy pulpiness and produces a cup that is sweet, full-bodied, distinctive and irresistible.  We think the result is outstanding. Yirgacheffe is more generally grown around the town of Yirgacheffe which lies as an island in the middle of Sidamo. This coffee is hand picked,[pullquote_right]Have you tasted our Ethiopian Konga natural Yirgacheffe yet? We think it’s rather special. It’s even been compared to “a hoppy IPA"[/pullquote_right] naturally processed, and is grown at around 1800-2000 metres altitude (on average). We love that it either makes you love it or hate it, and you certainly know its a different style of coffee to the mass produced stuff. We serve natural Yirgacheffee from Wote, a small processing station in the Konga region of Yirgacheffe. Wote is owned by Mr. Mergya and employs 100 workers. The station processes about 3 containers of coffee every year. There are about 600 farmers around Wote who bring their red cherries to the station, where they are pulped and dried. Many thousands of bags marked ‘Yirgacheffe’ are sold every year but there may be significant differences between them in terms of cup quality.
